Package de.oth.blocklib.shaders.environment

Class PrecipitationShader

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.shaders.ShaderProgram
de.oth.blocklib.shaders.BaseShader
de.oth.blocklib.shaders.environment.PrecipitationShader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Shader, java.lang.Comparable<Shader>
public class PrecipitationShader
extends BaseShader
Shader class for Precipitation (Rain, Snow). Includes a ComputeShader for calculating particle positions and modifying them.
Author:
Sven Kalle
See Also:
ShaderProgram, ComputeShader

  • Method Details

    • loadParticleSSBO

      public void loadParticleSSBO()
      Loads the particle SSBO with the Loader method. This is done so that the particles are newly loaded whenever the rain is activated from sunny or cloudy weather, so that the particles automatically spawn near the player. The buffer has to be deleted beforehand, so that there is no memory leak and all of the SSBOs get stored on the GPU even though they are not used anymore.

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the ComputeShader before rendering and then enables alpha-blending for the transparent textures.
      Specified by:
      start in interface Shader
      Overrides:

    • prepareComputeShader

      private void prepareComputeShader()
      Prepares the ComputeShader by loading all necessary uniforms.

    • startComputeShader

      private void startComputeShader()
      Starts the compute shader. The amount is calculated by the amount of particles, divided by 64 because the work local_size in precipitation.cs is set to 64.

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Disables alpha-blending after the rendering process.
      Specified by:
      stop in interface Shader
      Overrides:
      stop in class ShaderProgram

    • getPriority

      public int getPriority()
      Sets priority to transparent + 1. This is done so that the particles are rendered after other transparent objects, to make sure that no artifacts happen. Since the particles are rendered in an instanced rendering call, the MasterRenderer does not know all of the positions to sort the particles accordingly, which leads to artifacts, where the transparent parts of the texture are rendered in front of other transparent objects (e.g. Clouds).
      Specified by:
      getPriority in interface Shader
      Overrides:
      getPriority in class ShaderProgram
      Returns:
      priority of this shader. Defaults toShaderProgram.OPAQUE.
